main_definition: A peer is someone who is equal to another in abilities, qualifications, age, social status or other attributes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Equal in rank or status; a colleague or fellow member of an organization
meanings_and_examples.example: John and Jane are peers at the law firm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person of similar age, background or social standing
meanings_and_examples.example: The children played together as equals, like true peers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Participant in a competition who is equally matched to others in skill level
meanings_and_examples.example: In the boxing ring, each fighter was his own peer; neither dominated from the start.

meanings_and_examples.definition: One of two or more persons considered as equals because they have similar qualities or abilities
meanings_and_examples.example: As class valedictorian, she felt like a peer to everyone in her graduating year.
